name: SDR Manager / Sales Development Manager
description:
Please note: working hours are 17.00-2.00 (GMT+3)

Improvado’s Mission & Product
Imporvado is commited to a vision of minimizing transaction cost for people to get business answers. Today, data lives in many different siloes and business users need to rely on scarce technical resources in order to get the answers they need to do their job effecitvely. Improvado is changing that.

Our product is an Enterprise Platform for Marketers, Data Analysts, and Strategists that allows you to easily aggregate data from 250+ marketing platforms like Google, Facebook, Programmatic Media, into one place. We automate up to 90% of manual work related to reporting and 1.5 Billion records a day pass through Improvado’s Platform; Improvado’s ability to process high amounts of data at high speeds enables us to help Enterprise Brands more than anyone in the market. Some of our clients are Mattel, ATB Financial, Illy Cafe, Monster Energy, L’Oreal, HIMS, and the list goes on.

Our HQ is in San Francisco with offices globally.

We are looking for a passionate, data-driven Sales Development Manager to help accelerate our outbound prospecting efforts and expand pipeline across the Enterprise space. You will be responsible for coaching and manage a team of SDRs/BDRs. This role reports to SVP of Revenue.

Who You Are

  • A Sales Leader who has a passion for training, coaching, and developing talent
  • Creative problem solver that identifies new and innovative ways to drive top of funnel growth
  • Analytical thinker that leverages data to make decisions and recommendations
  • A natural motivator that inspires team members to achieve ambitious goals

About The Role
  • Directly manage a team of SDRs/BDRs to generate qualified meetings with decision-makers across the Enterprise market segment.
  • Own and drive execution of pipeline goals by understanding and analyzing top-of-the-funnel metrics, pipeline quality, and revenue produced across the Enterprise market segment.
  • Develop and execute new strategies for prospecting and outbound efforts that will be scaled across the Sales team.
  • Work cross-functionally with our Marketing, Solution Engineering and Customer Success to develop Sales led growth strategies.
  • Implement, improve, and standardize key sales processes in service of driving consistent and repeatable motions that predictably drive revenue growth.
  • Attract, hire, develop, and retain world-class SDR/BDR talent
  • Build and coach high-performing SDRs and BDRs to the next exceptional Account Executives

Requirements
  • Extremely High EQ & Empathy Skills
  • Genuinely Open & Curious
  • High Ethical Standards and Values consistent with Improvado’s Values
  • Fluency in English - written and verbal skills are critical to success in this role
  • Strong People Management & Collaborations Skills
  • 2+ years of leadership experience in SaaS (direct experience managing a team of SDRs/BDRs)
  • 2-3 years of business development and pipeline generation experience
  • Consistent track record of exceeding quota as an SDR Manager
  • Ability to drive and manage cross-functional initiatives at scale
  • Experienced in hiring and working in a rapidly growing environment
  • Strong knowledge of outbound technology and technique
  • Salesforce experience required
Nice to have
  • Experience within the Marketing industry
  • Experience with a startup is preferred
  • Experience Running a Global SDR/BDR Team


Why Improvado?

  • 100% remote position
  • Strong Product/Market Fit
  • Competitive Compensation Package (including a generous amount of equity for companies stage)
  • Ideal Time & Stage to Benefit from Companies Growth
  • The Ability to Design Your Team The Way You See It
  • Extremely Fun & Open Working Environment
  • Strong Ethics & Value System
  • A Large Team of Experienced Engineers
  • Investors in Improvado are Silicon Valley Elites; i.e., Jonah Goodhart (SVP Oracle Data Cloud, Former Founder & CEO of MOAT), Kim Perell (CEO Amobee), Toby Gabriner (Former CEO Nextroll, CEO Bitly), Auren Hoffman (Founder & Former CEO of LiveRamp), etc.. as well as Bullpen Capital and 500-Start Ups
